entry.title: Measure and Probability
entry.content:
Fundamental theorem 0：

Theorem: Let $f$,$g$ : $S \rightarrow \mathbf{R}$ be measurable and non-negative. Then

Proof: By theorem 2.4.1, we can find the increasing sequence of simple functions ($s_n$) that converges pointwise to $f$ and an increasing sequence of simple functions ($t_n$) that converges pointwise to $g$. Hence $(s_n+t_n)$ is an increasing sequence of simple functions that converges pointwise to $f+g$. So
